snippet: Richard M. Sherman, the surviving brother in the Disney songwriting duo who worked on “Mary Poppins,” recalls contending with P. L. Travers, the author of the children’s book that inspired the film.
lead_paragraph: Richard M. Sherman, the surviving brother in the Disney songwriting duo who worked on “Mary Poppins,” recalls contending with P. L. Travers, the author of the children’s book that inspired the film.
abstract: Richard Sherman, surviving brother in Disney songwriting duo who worked on Mary Poppins, recalls contending with combative P L Travers, author of the children’s book that inspired film; Sherman acted as consultant on Saving Mr Banks, which tells, in part, story of how Walt Disney used music to convince Travers to allow him to adapt her writing into film.
